channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: The live tennis coverage at London's famous Queen's Club continues, with some of the world's best players competing in the first women's tournament at the venue for more than half a century. Russian-born Olga Morozova was the last title-winner back in 1973, and there are a host of big names aiming to succeed her as the champion at the iconic venue. They include Madison Keys, an American who picked up her first Grand Slam title at 2025's Australian Open.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Previous players Michael Buerk, Kate Humble, Glenn Moore and Thanyia Moore take on a series of quiz rounds. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
channel.desc: Clive tries to make Tiramisu in the nearby town of Treviso, heads to the lakeside village of Limone to discover the secret to a long and healthy life, and finds out the story behind Europe's most northerly lemons. He also finds out how the balcony inspired by Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet now inspires lovers from around the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: Dublin-based architects Fiona and Paddy plan on converting a derelict cowshed on the Rockingham Estate into a contemporary family home, and commence their restoration project with a budget of ?350,000.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: A look at Pembrokeshire's wild and rugged coast, where life is defined by the rhythm of the seasons and the power of the sea.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan continue the deliberation of which nests will fledge before the end of the series. Plus a look at some of the wildlife predictions Springwatch has made over the last 20 years and whether any of them came true. Iolo Williams continues his exploration of the National Trust's Mount Stewart Estate on the banks of Strangford Lough.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: The endearing pangolin is a little-known scaly mammal. Found in Africa and Asia, these shy creatures have an unfortunate tagline, they are the most poached and illegally trafficked animals in the world. Based in Namibia, conservationist Maria Diekmann rescues and rehabilitates her local pangolins.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
channel.desc: Paul and Bob arrive in the Republic of Ireland, and they're kicking off their all-out Irish fishing trip on the River Finn. It's their first time fishing the rivers of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
channel.desc: John Simpson brings his expertise to bear on the most important stories. In discussion with the BBC's range of experts across the world, he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Surviving Syria's Prisons
channel.desc: They made thousands disappear. Now, the men who carried it out break their silence. In December 2024, the world witnessed the dramatic toppling of Syrian president Bashar al-Assad, ending a 13-year civil war. But beneath the celebrations is a grim legacy - over 100,000 Syrians disappeared. Their fate was hidden in prisons, mass graves and secret documents.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: The battle to save the homes and treasures left by two Royalist women who refused to submit during the English Civil War - Ham House and Corfe Castle.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Walking With Dinosaurs
channel.desc: North Africa, 100 million years ago. A Spinosaurus father must embark on a dangerous voyage to feed his babies. At the end of their journey, an extraordinary feast awaits - if he can run the gauntlet without his babies becoming someone else's meal.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jane Austen: Rise of a Genius
channel.desc: At 27, Jane Austen stands at a crossroads. After the loss of her father throws the family into turmoil, Jane publishes two successful novels, `Sense and Sensibility' and `Pride and Prejudice'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Martel meets a former boy band member turned property developer in Darlington who is hoping to create a high-end house in multiple occupation. Dion is on home turf with an Aston Villa fan looking to turn around a Birmingham terrace.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Charlie and Lee are in Manchester to transform James and Elizabeth's overgrown and unloved plot into a beach-inspired garden. They love to surf and would relish the chance of bringing a sense of the sea to their suburban back garden. Can the team achieve all this on a ?6,000 budget?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty is busy in the cottage garden. As the roses begin to bloom, he inserts underplanting. Adam Frost goes to a walled garden. Nick Bailey's aims to inspire everyone to transform outdoor spaces. A man turns a barren plot into a wonderful haven.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from the verdant lawns of Queen's, where the first women's tournament in more than half a century is firmly in its stride. At stake is not just lucrative prize money and the honour of becoming the first women's champion since 1973 but also the chance for vital grass court match practice ahead of Wimbledon, which starts later this month.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Previous players Michael Buerk, Kate Humble, Glenn Moore and Thanyia Moore take on a series of quiz rounds. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
channel.desc: Clive loves Venice, but on this trip, he wants to learn what it's like to be a local, outnumbered by tourists by over 200 to 1. He hitches a lift with a rare female gondolier and learns the tough craft of steering with one oar, gets a lesson in glass-blowing from his new friend Count Gibi, and finds out why Italian vegetables taste so great as he picks peppers on a farm in the Venetian lagoon.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great House Revival
channel.desc: Hugh Wallace meets artist Cora Murphy who has taken on the challenge of restoring a city townhouse and shop front, on Douglas Street, Cork.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: It is April, and farmers are out, sowing the peat-based soils that make this nation's richest source of crops, whilst also keeping an eye out for all the local wildlife.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: In the final episode of the series, Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are bidding farewell to the nests they've followed throughout the series. The Springwatch celebration of 20 years of British wildlife broadcasting continue with favourite moments from the series and audience contributions. Meanwhile, Iolo Williams wraps up his whistlestop tour of Northern Irish wildlife, and there's hope that live badgers might help see out a spectacular season.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Marie-Antoinette
channel.desc: The royal couple hope that Rohan's indictment will help contain the aristocracy's desire for rebellion. At the end of a turbulent trial, Rohan is exonerated, but a false testimony tarnishes Marie Antoinette's reputation.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: A pride of lions has rewritten the rules, they have learnt to take down elephants.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Detectorists
channel.desc: Lance is obsessed with finding the thief that stole his gold, which means he can ignore the melodrama going on at home. Andy's lies are catching up with him too. They decide that camping out is the safest option.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Last Bus
channel.desc: An old man whose wife has just passed away uses his free local bus pass to travel to the other end of the UK, to where they originally moved from, using only local buses, on a nostalgic trip but also carrying his wife's ashes in a small suitcase, `taking her back' and in doing so he meets local people. By the end of his trip he's a celebrity.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Political Thinking with Nick Robinson
channel.desc: To mark the 80th anniversary of VE Day, former president Joe Biden sits down with Nick Robinson for an exclusive interview, his first since leaving the White House.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: A flat in Wiltshire has some great potential, including a quirky cupboard with a lovely view, although Martin is concerned about access to the outside space. In Greater Manchester, Dion thinks a three-bedroom semi is ripe for extension.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Sarah has a huge challenge for robot maker Mark Haig involving some fishy forks.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Anna Haugh's Big Irish Food Tour
channel.desc: Mrs. Brown's Boys' actor Eilish O'Carroll joins Anna to explore their native Dublin. They head to Moore Street where the traditional market meets global street food.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's railway adventure reaches the Dalmatian coastal city of Zadar, once an important Venetian trading hub and still a centre for the production of a Venetian delicacy, Maraschino cherry liqueur. In Sibenik, Michael finds one of the first towns in the world to enjoy electric street lighting.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Political Thinking with Nick Robinson
channel.desc: Nick Robinson has a conversation with, not an interrogation of, the people who shape our political thinking about what shaped theirs.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Further live coverage from the women's event at Queen's, where the field of 32 has now been whittled down to eight - at stake for today's winners is a place in the semi-finals. The women's tournament is being held for the first time since 1973, but it has an impressive roll of honour, including Chris Evert and Britain's Ann Jones, who went on to lift the Wimbledon title a few weeks later. Presented by Isa Guha.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Former players Michael Buerk, Kate Humble, Glenn Moore and Thanyia Moore test their general knowledge skills on this week's Richard Osman's House of Games: Redemption Week.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Roadtrip
channel.desc: The UK drinks a third of Italy's prosecco, but British visitors rarely make it to this corner of the Veneto region. After spending a night in a giant wine barrel, Clive learns why prosecco is just as good as champagne from one of the country's few female winegrowers, before jumping into the navigator's seat in a 70-year-old Maserati and hunting for antiques in the hilltop town of Asolo.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
channel.desc: Paul follows the River Ayr as it flows from Loch Glenbuck towards the sea and the Clyde coast. The old mining village of Glenbuck was demolished long ago, but its memory is kept alive by former resident Barbara Alexander.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: George demonstrates how to give the gooseberries a light summer prune and also checks in on the blackcurrants and redcurrants planted last year. Calum looks at a variety of hostas and how to keep them free of slugs and snails.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: The team head to Birmingham for one of the highlights of the horticultural calendar - the annual Gardeners' World Live event.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: A moving work of art from the modernist home of architect Erno Goldfinger undergoes conservation work, and hidden messages from an old master are discovered at Upton House.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Inside No. 9
channel.desc: Jason, Lynne and their two teenage daughters try out their local escape room, The Killer's Lair. It's not really the girls' idea of fun, but they love their dad, and he loves following the clues and solving the puzzles.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Last Black Man in San Francisco
channel.desc: Jimmie and his best friend Mont try to reclaim the house built by Jimmie's grandfather, launching them on a poignant odyssey that connects them to their past, even as it tests their friendship and sense of belonging in the place they call home.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
channel.desc: Will Young learns about his grandfather's time as a prisoner of war in World War II. Delving further back, Will finds a connection to one of medieval history's biggest villains, and a king.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
channel.desc: The heroes and the Council of Happiness swap jobs, and when the council fail their quest, the whole forest is at risk of being flooded by Stinkystuff.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: After the Yeti's house is destroyed, the Lemmings are quick to point the finger at Grizzy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: Grizzy decides to adopt a coconut.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Pok?mon Horizons: The Series
channel.desc: Dot's implementation Tera training test begins. Her battle opponent is gym leader Larry. Unlike the assessment test, the implementation test requires battling with two Pok?mon. Will Dot manage to pass with Quaxly and Tinkatink's help?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: Adam and Joe break out the superhero costumes for another round of this hilarious competition.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Operation Ouch!
channel.desc: How does your body know when you need a wee? An illusion turns Dr Xand's face green.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Blue Peter
channel.desc: Former `Strictly' winner and wildlife hero Hamza is in the `Blue Peter' garden.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsround
channel.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: The team head to Birmingham for one of the highlights of the horticultural calendar - the annual Gardeners' World Live event.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: In Which We Serve
channel.desc: World War II drama about the crew of a British fighting ship, told through a series of vignettes. The story of the ship's heroic deeds is narrated by the ship's captain, who acts as a father-figure to his stalwart men. After surviving a torpedo attack, the ship is involved in the Dunkirk evacuation, before heading into battle off the coast of Crete.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Magnificent Seven
channel.desc: A Mexican village is at the mercy of Calvera, the leader of a band of outlaws. The townspeople, too afraid to fight for themselves, hire seven American gunslingers to free them from the bandits' raids. The professional gunmen train the villagers to defend themselves, then plan a trap for the evil Calvera.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Armchair Britain
channel.desc: Miriam Margolyes is the guide around stunning surfing beaches, the ancient and mysterious Bodmin Moor, and the modern wonder of the Eden Project.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
channel.desc: A moving work of art from the modernist home of architect Erno Goldfinger undergoes conservation work, and hidden messages from an old master are discovered at Upton House.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin and experts Adam Partridge and Christina Trevanion are at Hereford Cathedral.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Jane Austen: Rise of a Genius
channel.desc: Determined to secure her financial future, Austen dives back into her writing.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Trooping the Colour
channel.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the spectacular military display from Horse Guards Parade in London, where the colour of No 7 Company Coldstream Guards are trooped to mark the King's official birthday.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: 40 Hits of 1985 at the BBC
channel.desc: A trip into the BBC's archives for a selection of songs from 1985, including Elton John, Duran Duran, Foreigner, Billy Ocean, Marillion, Go West, Strawberry Switchblade and Kirsty MacColl.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top of the Pops
channel.desc: Celebrating the biggest hits of 1985 with a selection of iconic performances spanning the genres, from pure pop to power ballads, from Hi-NRG to hip-hop, to R&B and indie classics.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top of the Pops
channel.desc: Top of the Pops in 1985 is a barometer for the state of the nation as the ambitious A-ha, King and Dead or Alive compete for attention with passionate politicos Billy Bragg and The Style Council.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Decision to Leave
channel.desc: A detective investigating a man's death in the mountains ends up meeting and developing feelings for the dead man's mysterious wife in the course of his dogged sleuthing.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
channel.desc: Carol Kirkwood explores gardening subjects that all begin with the letter K.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: Weatherman Derek Brockway is in Flintshire, at the most northerly point of mainland Wales. His walk starts off at the site of the Point of Ayr Colliery, where he meets John Wiltshire, passionate about keeping the memory of the mine alive.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Landward
channel.desc: Dougie is in Motherwell to visit Baron's Haugh Nature Reserve, an urban wetland along the River Clyde. Elsewhere, Shahbaz visits one of Wester Ross's ancient Caledonian pine forests.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Farming Life
channel.desc: Lambing season is just a month away for most of the farmers. In central Scotland, Anne is left in charge of the farm on her own and begins by feeding breakfast to over 2,000 animals. In the far north, John heads to the vet with a pedigree ewe.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Funny Face
channel.desc: A Madison Avenue photographer transforms a timid saleswoman into one of the fashion world's most glamorous models. The Gershwin-scored film includes `How Long Has This Been Going On?, He Loves and She Loves, and `S Wonderful'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Super League Rugby
channel.desc: The huge hits of rugby league's premier domestic competition continue as play-off rivals Wakefield Trinity and Leigh Leopards face off at Belle Vue. Wakefield have impressed on their return to Super League following promotion in 2024, and their star-studded squad equalled their record victory in this competition by scoring 13 tries in a thrashing of Salford in May 2025. Trinity take on a Leopards side who made the Super League semi-finals for the first time in 2024.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin and the team are in Greater Manchester, where over 800 people have come along to have their items valued at Stockport Town Hall. Paul is joined by experts Mark Stacey and Philip Serrell as they pick out their favourite antiques to take to auction. Mark is wowed by a William De Morgan ceramic tile, Paul finds some etchings by artist John Buckland Wright and Philip discovers a gold necklace that surprises everyone at auction.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: WA Diamond League Athletics
channel.desc: Live coverage as some of the biggest superstars in world athletics descend on the Swedish capital, including the return to action of Keely Hodgkinson. The Team GB poster girl has not raced since winning Olympic gold in Paris 2024, and she faces an elite field in the 800m, with the top eight ranked runners all due to take part in Stockholm. A blockbuster battle is also set for the women's 100m, with Britain's Dina Asher-Smith and Daryll Neita facing off against Julien Alfred and Julia Henriksson.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Race Across the World
channel.desc: After racing nearly 13,000 kilometres over seven weeks through China, Nepal and India, the four teams are about to embark on the final leg of the race. As the race comes to an end, the teams take a moment to reflect on their experiences.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: It's an American special as Jeremy, Richard and James try to prove that a fly-drive holiday to Florida would be more fun if you bought a car instead of renting one. Having picked up some wheels for no more than $1,000 each, the boys embark on an epic road trip to find out who got the best deal, encountering heat, flies and very angry locals along the way.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Greece with Simon Reeve
channel.desc: Simon Reeve travels from the islands of the Aegean to Greece's capital, Athens. To learn more about Greece and the Greeks, he meets an extraordinary cast of characters, from gun-toting priests to the last remaining sponge divers. Getting behind the postcard image of this beautiful country, he finds out how the Greeks are coming to terms with a seemingly endless crisis.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: With rockers Wet Leg, legendary band Sparks, Italian composer Ludovico Einaudi, south London/Colombian singer Sasha Keable, LA singer Annahstasia, and Scottish artist Brooke Combe. Concluding the line up are three voices.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Later ... with Jools Holland
channel.desc: With girl group Sugababes, London rockers Wolf Alice, wordsmith Kae Tempest, Nigerian-born Obongjayar, Donegal's George Houston, and folk legend Peggy Seeger.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Respect
channel.desc: Aretha Franklin sings in her father's church choir as a child and grows up to become an international musical superstar and legend.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Question Time
channel.desc: Features a studio audience quizzing top politicians on the events of the day. The panel surrounding presenter Fiona Bruce is composed of at least one member of the three major parties.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Not Going Out
channel.desc: Lee and Lucy view a property that Lucy loves when, embarrassingly, Lee needs the loo. Before he can use it however, a second buyer turns up to take a look, making Lee pretend to be a vendor.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: An array of mouthwatering recipes from Ching-He Huang, Georgina Hayden, Shauna Froydenlund and Tom Parker-Bowles. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers journey across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: Chris and Michaela reveal more wildlife wonders at the Longshaw Estate, Iolo's urban adventure continues in Belfast, and Megan meets some of the nocturnal residents of Haddon Hall.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: It's the men's turn to take centre stage at London's famous venue as the top male players battle it out in what's likely to be their final tournament ahead of Wimbledon. An all-star entry list includes reigning Wimbledon champion Carlos Alcaraz, British number one Jack Draper and American big-hitter Taylor Fritz. In 2024, the USA's Tommy Paul defeated Italy's Lorenzo Musetti in the final, with Paul returning this year to defend his title. Clare Balding presents.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson spends time with old friend and actor Kevin Whately. They reminisce about growing up in North East England before heading to Alnmouth beach to try their hands at making pictures in the sand at low tide.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Earth's Great Rivers
channel.desc: The Mississippi, from frozen waterfalls to time-travelling barges, from busy beavers to mysterious swamps, connects a continent like no other river. At the end of its 3,500-mile journey, it creates one of the biggest river deltas on the planet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
channel.desc: Steph and her two children live in St Annes near Blackpool. Recently divorced, Steph is excited about making a fresh start by transforming her garden. It's currently a dilapidated outside space, mostly enveloped by shade.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: A quiet estate in Shrewsbury is the scene of a horrific killing when 23-year-old delivery driver Aurman Singh is ambushed and fatally assaulted in broad daylight. West Mercia Police begin a major manhunt to track down his killers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Upstart Crow
channel.desc: Will has finished writing `Romeo and Juliet' but now there is competition for who will play Juliet. Kate feels the part should be hers, but lady-acting is against the law, and Burbage and Condell may no longer look like young teenage lovers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Race Across the World
channel.desc: After racing nearly 13,000 kilometres over seven weeks through China, Nepal and India, the four teams are about to embark on the final leg of the race. As the race comes to an end, the teams take a moment to reflect on their experiences.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Pitzhanger Manor and Gallery in Ealing, West London, where treasures include a royal paintbox, a stylish collection of Italian jewellery, and a rare wartime medal awarded to a carrier pigeon. Frances Christie is thrilled to find a moving work by eminent 20th-century sculptor Dame Elisabeth Frink, while a couple of eerie Victorian cut-out figures, known as 'dummy boards', bring a smile to Mark Hill's face.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: A short distance from the auction in Royal Wootton Bassett, Eric Knowles finds himself on a hillside, marvelling at the Hackpen White Horse. At the antiques fair in Exeter, two teams hope to carve out profits, helped by Izzie Balmer and Serhat Ahmet.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Garden Rescue
channel.desc: Flo and Lee are in Bristol to create a garden for Emi and Song that draws on their combined Japanese heritage and love of the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Extraordinary Portraits
channel.desc: Bill Bailey challenges a young artist to paint Marva and Lionel, who have fostered almost 200 teenagers.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Alison Hammond's Big Weekend
channel.desc: Alison Hammond spends a big weekend with Sir Lenny Henry, discussing his career, early fame and complex childhood, from losing his mother to discovering his biological father.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live Tennis: ATP & WTA Queen's 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from London's iconic tennis venue as the first round of 2025's men's tournament continues at Queen's Club. The opening round provided mixed fortunes for home hopes in 2024, with Jack Draper and Andy Murray, on his final appearance, making it through. Cameron Norrie, however, was beaten in a thrilling match by 2016 Wimbledon finalist Milos Raonic, while Dan Evans was forced to retire against Brandon Nakashima. Clare Balding presents.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Kaye Adams, Alex Brooker, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Isy Suttie take on a series of quizzes selected by Richard. A daily winner is declared at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week to find an overall House of Champions winner.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
channel.desc: Robson is reunited with acting pal Angela Lonsdale in the Northumberland countryside. Angela lets Robson introduce her to wild swimming at Sweethope Lough under the watchful eye of Team GB cold-water swimmer Fenwick Ridley.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Villages by the Sea
channel.desc: Ben Robinson finds evidence of early pilgrimage at a remarkable Norman priory. In a 500-year-old house in the village, the archaeologist examines a wall mural that proves it was the birthplace of an important Elizabethan archbishop.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Nigella: Cook, Eat, Repeat
channel.desc: Nigella debates whether one should meddle with classics. She thinks that in the case of her crab mac`n'cheese, it's a must. If the sight of glorious melted cheese isn't enough, fear not, as she follows it with her `mine all mine chocolate cookies'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Richard McCourt and Dominic Wood are in a vintage Land Rover Series 2 as they scour every nook, cranny and dusty shelf in Hampshire for treasures to sell at auction. They're joined on their journey by Irita Marriott and David Harper.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder 24/7
channel.desc: Following teams of detectives and specialists involved in murder investigations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: QI
channel.desc: More of the best moments from the U series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with Alan and their guests.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Small Town, Big Riot
channel.desc: Mobeen Azhar investigates how a protest outside an asylum seeker hotel turned into a riot, uncovering a blueprint for a national wave of violence that eight months later would affect us all.
